review: This has been a great way to use our Netflix streaming and we've been pleasantly surprised by the ease of using it for random YouTube watching as well. Easy setup: plugged it into the side of the TV, paired it with our WIFI network, used apps on our phones to start watching. We like pausing playback frequently and we were originally annoyed by the slight delay, but we've gotten used to it. When our phones go to sleep, the connection has to be re-established and we sometimes have to hit the pause button several times before it registers. All in all, love the simplicity and like the fact that we don't have to fire up our much louder and less energy efficient PS3 to watch Netflix anymore!

review: I bought the Chromecast device with the only purpose to use the mirroring feature with my iPad Air. And, for the moment, there's no such possibility. You're limited to a few apps as are Google Music, YouTube, NetFlix, etc. There's a Chrome browser extension but, unfortunately, it only works with desk & laptop devices. In addition to that i tested Chromecast with my Samsung TV using the Google Music app and switching from the TV speakers to my external speakers through an optical wire (as i do normally with my SAT receiver) and to my great surprise it didn't work neither.

Not smooth at all. I have a 26 mbps Internet speed and was broadcasting from less than 7 ft. All my devises (WiFi router,  Laptop and the TV) are in a very close proximity to each-other in  the same area. I barely can use the product. It is good for slideshow though.Sometimes it works well for YouTube. But the movies that I can watch smoothly on my LT can not be delivered to TV smoothly.
